meanings.definition: A feeling of sickness or discomfort caused by high altitude.
meanings.sent1: The hikers experienced soroche when they reached the mountain peak.
meanings.sent2: Altitude climbers often struggle with soroche at high elevations.
meanings.sent3: The soroche at the summit made the climbers dizzy but determined.
meanings.sent4: The soroche enveloped them like a heavy fog, slowing their progress.
meanings.sent5: The intense soroche made it hard to catch their breath, even at rest.

meanings.sent1: She began to soroche as they ascended the steep mountain trail.
meanings.sent2: If you ascend too quickly, you may soroche and feel unwell.
meanings.sent3: The group had to stop frequently to soroche and catch their breath.
meanings.sent4: As they climbed higher, they could feel themselves soroche with each step.
meanings.sent5: He soroched heavily, feeling the effects of the altitude on his body.
